casebody.data:
DUKE ENERGY CAROLINAS, LLC
v.
GRAY, et al. No. 108PA14-2. Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 21, 2015. Debbie W. Harden, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Meredith J. McKee, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Jackson R. Price, Charlotte. John R. Buric, Charlotte, for Gray, Herbert A. Preston O. Odom, III, Charlotte, for Gray, Herbert A. Fred W. DeVore, III, Charlotte, for Builder Support Services Of The Carolinas, Inc., et al. Derek P. Adler, Charlotte. Erik M. Rosenwood, Charlotte, for Yarbrough-Williams & Houle, Inc. Mark R. Kutny, Charlotte. Lawrence J. Goldman, Charlotte, for Lucas-Forman, Inc. Gregory W. Brown, Raleigh, for Carter Land Surveyors & Planners, Inc. Kristi L. Gavalier, Raleigh. Matthew D. Rhoad, Raleigh, for Piedmont Natural Gas Company, Inc., et al. Davis F. Roach, Raleigh, for Piedmont Natural Gas Company, Inc., et al. Joseph W. Eason, Raleigh, for N.C. Electric Membership Corporation, et al. Martin Warf, for N.C. Electric Membership Corporation, et al. Kimberly S. Hibbard, General Counsel, for N.C. League of Municipalities. Gregory F. Schwitzgebel, III, Associate General Counsel, for N.C. League of Municipalities. Daniel F. McLawhorn, Associate City Attorney, for N.C. League of Municipalities.

Opinion

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 20th of July 2015 by NC League of Municipalities for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 21st of July 2015."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
